page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: { Arbuthnott Parish Church}is the local Kirk, and is one of the few pre-Reformation churches still in use for public worship. At 10am. on Sundays an average of 20 people gather for Morning Service. There are 9 Elders, 2 of whom are ladies. The Minister also has charge of Kinneff Parish, and lives in the Manse at Kinneff. The Arbuthnott Church stands on ground which has been consecrated since the 13th century at least. It was originally a Roman Catholic Chapel, but is now{Church of Scotland. The burial ground surrounding the Church contains memorials to many local families, including the Arbuthnott Family. The Roman Catholics and Episcopalians have to go outside the area to their places of worship.
